awd_titl_txt: Analysis of the Data from North Dakota Thunderstorm Project
awd_abstract_narration: Squall lines occur over most moist areas of the Earth.  In the             Great Plains of the United States, a large fraction of the growing              season precipitation comes from squall lines.  In addition, severe              weather is common with squall line systems.                                          The Principal Investigator will continue research into the                 structure of squall lines.  This will be both an observational and              numerical modeling effort using data collected during the North                 Dakota Thunderstorm Project.  A particularly unique aspect of this              research is that a wide range of aircraft and remote sensing                    observations exist on the early stages of the squall lines                      lifetime.  This provides an opportunity to study the development of             a feature known as the rear inflow jet which has been shown to be               a dynamically important feature of squall lines.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
